article.title: Illustrated key for the identification of the known zoeal stages of brachyuran crabs (Crustacea: Decapoda) from tropical and subtropical Brazil, southwestern Atlantic
article.abstract: Approximately 370 brachyuran species have so far been recorded from the Brazilian coast, 123 of which have had theirlarval stages fully or partially described. The pictorial guide allows the identification of the first zoea of 110 species. Theremaining 13 species with known larval stages are treated to the genus level because of difficulties in the morphological differentiation of closely related species.

indexing.subject: Brachyura; identification key; first zoea larva; southwestern Atlantic; Brazil
indexing.subject_class: Brachyura; identification key; first zoea larva

article.title: A new species of Coleodactylus Parker, 1926 (Squamata: Sphaerodactylidae) from the Atlantic Forest of northeast Brazil
article.abstract: A new species, Coleodactylus elizae sp. nov., is described for the Atlantic Forest of Northeastern Brazil. It is distinguishedfrom other Coleodactylus species by the following character combinations: one nearly completely divided or two rostralscales, dorsal scales smooth and four scales forming the ungual sheath. The color pattern consists of white spots distributed over a pinkish background. Coleodactylus elizae sp. nov. is a forest species inhabiting bromeliads.

article.title: A new species of Parapercis (Teleostei: Pinguipedidae) from Madagascar
article.abstract: A new species of sandperch is described from the shallow nearshore reefs of the Masoala Peninsula, northeastern Mada-gascar. The new species is distinguished from congeners occurring in the region by a unique pigmentation pattern on thecaudal fin comprising two large, oblong black blotches, with the smaller of the two markings located dorsally near the finbase and a much larger and more elongate patch situated ventrally, as well as the presence of numerous smaller blackblotches forming two to three bands distally on the caudal membrane, two longitudinal series of six to nine prominentblack blotches on the mid and lower flank, and the presence of large diffuse dark brown blotches on the snout, lips, cheek and opercle.

indexing.subject: grubfish; Masoala Peninsula; Parapercis maramara sp. nov., sandperch; Western Indian Ocean

article.title: Neocoprozercon europaeus gen. nov., sp. nov., the first member of the family Coprozerconidae (Acari: Mesostigmata) in the Palaearctic Region
article.abstract: A new genus and species, Neocoprozercon europaeus gen. nov., sp. nov., are described, based on adults and deutonymphscollected from soil detritus and animal excrement in a cave in theČierna hora Mts., Western Carpathians, Slovakia.Amendments to the diagnosis of the family Coprozerconidae Moraza & Lindquist, 1998 and a key to the genera are presented.

article.title: Revalidation of the genus Ectrepopterus Fowler (Teleostei: Characiformes), with the redescription of its type species, E. uruguayensis
article.abstract: Ectrepopterus uruguayensis Fowler 1943 is redescribed based on the holotype and new series of additional specimensfrom the río Uruguay, río Negro, and small coastal rivers in Uruguay draining to the río de La Plata. Previously proposedsynonyms of Ectrepopterus Fowler 1943 to Megalamphodus Eigenmann 1915 and Hyphessobrycon Durbin 1908 aretested and refuted. A new diagnosis is presented for the genus based on the following apomorphies: foramen in posteriorregion of metapterygoid forms an incomplete arch, bordered posteriorly by the hyomandibula; pectoral-fin rays bearinghooks; posterior margin of second infraorbital posteroventrally oblique and second infraorbital ventrally borderinganterior region of third infraorbital; fourth infraorbital more developed longitudinally than dorsoventrally; ascending process of premaxilla reaching just anterior end of nasal; and lateral line interrupted.

article.title: The first record of Cavernulina orientalis (Thomson & Simpson, 1909) (Octocorallia: Pennatulacea: Veretillidae) from the Bay coast of Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh
On the identity of the generic name Iulidesmus Silvestri, 1895 (Polydesmida: Paradoxosomatidae) RICHARD L. HOFFMAN (USA)
